meanings.def: used to say what is the right thing to do
examples: They ought to apologize.
They ought to have apologized (= but they didn't).
Such things ought not to be allowed.
He oughtn't to have been driving so fast.
(formal) ‘Ought I to write to say thank you?’ ‘Yes, I think you ought (to).’
You should take the baby to the doctor’s.
I ought to give up smoking.
Should we call the doctor?
We’d better hurry or we’ll miss the train.
She should have asked for some help.
You ought to have been more careful.
You shouldn’t drive so fast.
I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have lost my temper.

meanings.def: used to say what you expect or would like to happen
examples: Children ought to be able to read by the age of 7.
Nurses ought to earn more.

meanings.def: used to say what you advise or recommend
examples: We ought to be leaving now.
This is delicious. You ought to try some.
You ought to have come to the meeting. It was interesting.

meanings.def: used to say what has probably happened or is probably true
examples: If he started out at nine, he ought to be here by now.
That ought to be enough food for the four of us.
Oughtn't the water to have boiled by now?
